reviews.text: Due to a mix up, we ended up needing to stay one night in the Park at Yellowstone. We ended up at this hotel by default and I am glad to say, it was for one night only.
reviews.title: One Night Only

likes.liked: — location in Yellowstone National Park - a fantastic place.

reviews.text: Have you seen " The Shining"? The building will definitely remind you of it.
reviews.title: Well...

likes.liked: — The hotel overlooks Lake yellowstone, which is absolutely beautiful.

reviews.text: It is accomodation at its most basic, we had one of the largest rooms (according to the surly front desk staff - in fact surliness seems to be a requirement to work there) It was pretty small and was decorated in a 1960's Holiday Inn type style. I shudder to think of what those cottages on the property would be like.They looked like storage units!
reviews.title: Good location, nice room, read reviews

reviews.text: I have never seen such low wattage light bulbs or thin towels anywhere, either.
reviews.title: clean cabins, herds of bison in the evening, central location

reviews.text: To be fair, it was clean, and we had a decent (although way overpriced ) meal in the dining room. but that's it.
reviews.title: Quiet charm of another era with fabulous views

likes.liked: — The quiet elegance, views, dining and sunset bus tour

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The initial impression of the hotel from a distance and subsequent access into the large salon through the grand entrance was very impressive, however, after that it was all downhill.
reviews.title: A disgrace to Yellowstone

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We arrived at 2.30 and said that although we expected that the room might not be ready to check into, it might be useful just to complete the paperwork in advance. The receptionist told us that the room would be available “within the hour” so we didn’t think it was worth going anywhere for such a short time and just went down to the lakeside to admire the view. On returning at 3.45, reception told us that our room would not be available until 4.30 and that we had been given the incorrect information by the original receptionist – not a good start. If we had been told at 2.30 not to come back until 4.30 we could have done something productive with the 2 hours instead of wasting our precious holiday time just hanging about.
reviews.title: Like being whisked back in time - in a good way!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: On returning again at 4.30, we were allocated room 442, but were horrified at its condition. We expected the room to be small and knew it didn’t have air conditioning, but we did not expect to find: -
reviews.title: Clean but tired

reviews.text:  Such a TIRED, SHABBY and EXTREMELY DEPRESSING room.
reviews.title: Lake Yellowstone Frontier Cabins

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text:  Rotting window frames with the paint flaking off the frames and sill (inside was a
reviews.title: A beautiful setting

reviews.text: I managed to get the booking through the Xanterra website a couple of months before travelled which was very lucky. I wanted a special hotel for my Husband to wake up in on his birthday. I have to say I don't think this was it. The room, whilst ok, was nothing special at all. It was probably the smallest room we have stayed in this visit. It had its own bathroom and a nice view of the lake but thats about the best I can say for it. I think every man and his kids ran up and down the corridor slamming the doors which seemed to echo through our room. Luckily most people didn't stay up too late or we would have had trouble sleeping!
reviews.title: Expensive, but the location is good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The restaurant was nice but expensive and I felt trying to be more up market than it could manage. The meal was good but I still felt I was being ripped off.
reviews.title: Loved the yellow cabins!

reviews.text: All in all it was ok but apart from a good view and being located in the park this was a let down.
reviews.title: Great location, great atmosphere

reviews.text: We stayed at Lake Yellowstone Hotel and Cabins at the end of July for 4 nights. The cabin was a stand alone. Very comfortable beds. The bathrooms were spotless and the housekeepers did a great job. The sink area outside the bedroom really gave us extra room to set up our "kitchen".
reviews.title: Nice refurbished cabins

reviews.text: The room has a coffee pot. There is lots of windows for good air flow. The lake area is windy ! There was also a fan provided if needed. My only wish would be for a little porch, but we honestly did not spend time in the room except to sleep!
reviews.title: Trying Hard

likes.liked: — The solarium and the dining room.
likes.disliked: — The rooms need to be updated.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We traveled to Yellowstone in early June. I had booked 5 nights at the hotel at a cost of $250/night. The hotel itself is a beautiful, old facility in the common areas. However, the room we were shown to was tiny with two very hard beds, no TV, no A/C, no closet, nowhere to put our suitcases. The bathroom was tiny and the door opened into it making it even worse. The hotel has no WIFI and there's no cell phone service there. We immediately decided we weren't going to stay more than one night. So how do you find another hotel without cell phone or internet access? Luckily, I had a AAA guidebook with me and used the land line to find a nice Holiday Inn in West Yellowstone. My advice is to skip staying in the park. West Yellowstone has several nice chains to choose from and it's very close to the west entrance to the park. When I go on vacation, I want comfort as well as to see beautiful sights. If you like to rough it, so be it. But we don't.
reviews.title: Don't expect a nice room!

reviews.text: I thought it was pretty expensive for the small room. It was a Standard Double. $250. The best thing about the hotel was the view of the lake and the location in the middle of the park. One thing that really bothered me.. when I checked in, I was told that the menu at the restaurant that night was going to be very minimal and I was to check with the person over by the restaurant to make sure I really wanted to keep our dinner reservation that night. I walked over to the employee at the entrance of the restaurant and told her I was supposed to talk to her about their limited menu options. She said yes, it was going to be just the cold items on the appetizer menu available. And most likely only 3 dinner entre choices.. Fish and beef and probably something vegetarian. I thought that was odd and wondered in their busiest summer month, why would they have such a limited menu. I told her I'd think about it. We decided to keep the reservation. When I asked our waiter if everything on the menu was available.. He said Yes? Like he thought I was crazy for even asking. What's up with that? Was someone staying at the hotel trying so hard to get a reservation for their dinner that they were trying to make us cancel ours. Really does bother me.
reviews.title: Fair

reviews.text: I love this restaurant. As you know, there isn't much of a choice in Yellowstone for restaurants so that's why this one is my favorite. We ate breakfast which was an amazing buffet and lunch. We even drove back to eat lunch here from 50 miles away. The food is always good and the service as well.
reviews.title: Great restaurant at the hotel.

reviews.text: We stayed in a cabin at Lake Yellowstone. When we pulled in, I was a little concerned due to the outside looks of the cabins, but we were pleasantly surprised on how nice the cabin was on the inside. It was clean and spacious. The bathroom was nice. They even had a single serve Kuerig for those coffee lovers out there. I have often thought hotels should all get Kuerigs in the rooms for the simplicity of making a cup of coffee in the morning. There is the hotel dining room close by and also the general store where you can opt to get a few groceries if you want a picnic in the park. Overall this was a really nice place to stay for the money. Just be sure to book early.
reviews.title: Don't judge by the outside

reviews.text: We booked the last room for two nights more than a month before our visit - and they were the last rooms in the whole park. The centralised booking system, run by the park concessionaire, Xanterra, is not easy - phone and wait for ages to get through, but it is more reliable than trying to use the on-line system.
reviews.title: Book early and don't be unrealistic about WiFi!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is an 1800's building - NO soundproofing AT ALL. Walls are paper thin, you hear EVERY noise, especially people clomping up and down the halls. You can feel the floor movement! (One night I awoke in fright thinking someone was in our room). Housekeeping has absolutely no regard for you. They start cleaning the moment anyone leaves, regardless of the time of the morning. Although clean, the rooms are in desperate need of remodeling. The carpet in the entire place is filthy and looks at least 20 years old. We stayed in Room 448 facing the lake. The bed was absolutely the hardest thing we've EVER slept on, and we travel a lot!! We asked for addl blankets and folded them and the comforter to put under the sheets. We actually left one day early because the bed was so bad. The restaurant food and service was absolutely fabulous one night and awful the next, so it may be the luck of the draw. Dinner reservations are a must unless you want a long wait. The sun room is very nice with commanding views, although very crowded in the evening. There is not a t.v. in the place so buy a paper if you want to know what's going on in the world. With the exception of housekeeping, the rest of the staff throughout the hotel was wonderful!! Very cheerful and helpful. Overall I'd say definitely go for a nice meal, charm and a drink in the sun room but skip the overnight stay.
reviews.title: Room Awful, Food Good

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The last two nights of our Yellowstone trip and this hotel was a great way bring it to a close. Corner room on the second floor (#260) gave us a beautiful view of the lake and the woods around it. Very clean, nice sized bathroom with a tub. Quiet and comfortable. Didn't hear any howling wolves, but saw lots of wildlife all around. The lobby and sunroom are crowded in the evening, but you'll meet fun people. Our last night found a tour group gathered around the piano and singing--fun to listen and watch. Front desk and bell staff were friendly, smiling, and ready to make suggestions for places to see wildlife.
reviews.title: View, comfort, and good food
Third time and still charmed
reviews.text: Lake area is fortunate to have the hotel and the lodge. We ate in the cafeteria at the lodge for a breakfast and dinner. Very affordable and the food was quite tasty. The lodge has laundry facilities, too, which came in handy. We also at the hotel for a breakfast and dinner. Absolutely the two best meals that we had at any of the park faciilties. Outstanding service, above par food, and even the breakfast buffet was wonderful.
This was our third trip to Lake Yellowstone cabins. Our third time in a standalone cabin (there are some that join together). This time around we stayed in cabin 530.
reviews.title: Nice cabins

reviews.text: We love the Lake area. The lobby in the hotel is beautiful, but we never tear ourselves away from the park's wonders to sit and enjoy it.
reviews.title: Basic and elegant at the same time

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: While yes the hotel is older and has no air, the lobby, bar, and dining make up for it! The room is large and bathroom as well. There is an elevator. Make your reservations early for the dining, it is very good food. I REALLY RECOMMEND the pear and blue cheese ravioli. The lobby has a beautiful view of the lake and a live piano player, as well as a bar. We sipped drinks from the bar, sat in comfy chairs and listened to the live music all night.
reviews.title: Classy Stay

reviews.text: we booked the yellowstone lake hotel and cabins as we thought it seemed to have a bit of character and history, not really when you get there
reviews.title: very disappointed in accomodation

reviews.text: we have just returned from a trip to the national parks, our second stop after best western at jackson grand tetons was the yellowstone lake hotel and cabins. on arrival we were allocated a cabin, which we had booked, but the standard of the cabin was too far below acceptable. we understood that the cabins would be poor from the pictures and the description as "not refurbished as the hotel rooms" but there has to be some sort of standard. the size illustrated in adverts was deceptive, the actual cabin was two accomodations back to back. the room was small with two small 3/4 divans, the carpet was rank and filthy, wipe your feet before you exit,. there was two very old chairs, one small writing table with a drawer. no cupboard, no wardrobe 3 hangers on a pole. there was one small sink with a mirror and a shower cubical and toilet the decor was the worst that could be imagined, it was horrible. there was nowhere to sit outside the cabins as the area around the cabins is gravel and weeds. no chairs other than the 2 inside the cabin. i believe that you were expected to sit in the cocktail lounge of the refurnished hotel lounge area. we did not travel to yellowstone national park to sit and drink inside a hotel lounge.
reviews.title: The only thing good about this hotel is its in the park.

reviews.text: we immediately went back to reception to ask if we could be moved, we were told there was no other accomodation available. fine, we asked to upgrade, suddenly there was one room available in the hotel at an upgrade charge of 225 dollars per night, but one of the party would have to sleep on the floor. amazingly two rooms were now available at 225 dollars per night ( this was on top of the 157 dollars per night which was already paid)
reviews.title: Pleasantly surprised, although overpriced
A Tale of Two Rooms
reviews.text: we declined and asked that we be informed if there was any other availability within the parks

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Filthy! Pretty much sums up the experience we had at Lake Yellowstone!! We took a 10 day vacation to Yellowstone and this was by far the worst and most expensive place we stayed! We originally had booked 3 nights but after seeing the room went back downstairs and informed them we would be leaving the next morning! ( would have left that night but were too tired to travel another 2 hours to try and locate another hotel.) Soooooo disappointed!!!!!! Carpets had not been vacuumed in a loooong time!! Hotel is old, which we can handle... its the nastiness I cannot tolerate. Staff was very unfriendly unless you were checking in. while we were there an employee quit right in front of us!!!! Talked to a friend of an employee and the company does not take care of their staff or the hotel!! Very negative experience!!!!! Do not recommend this hotel!!!!!
reviews.title: Filthy!

reviews.text: We actually stayed most of the time at the bridge bay campground. We had a snafu with my husband’s cpap machine and had to spend one night in a hotel. This happened around 11 pm at night. We drove over to the Lake Yellowstone Hotel because it was the closest lodge to our campground. They told my husband they only had one room available (which is believable this time of the year) and usually it cost $280 ( I think is rather pricey for the amenities; you are paying for the location) but they were willing to give us a deal for approximately $120 for the night since it was so late and they like to have all the rooms filled each night. The room was very well kept. It only had one bed so the kids slept on an air mattress on the flood. They had no TV and no air-conditioning. Thankfully it was cool out. We opened the windows and it actually got cold enough to close them over night.
reviews.title: Expensive but great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Now the view for the hotel is spectacular. Yellowstone Lake is beautiful. We also saw several bison and elk roaming around near the lake. This was not the night we stayed but another evening we went to the general store on the same grounds.
reviews.title: Beautiful views!
Good choice of lodging in Yellowstone Park
reviews.text: In a pinch it did the job we needed. I'm don't know if we'd go back mostly because of the price. We camp for a reason, it's cheap! :) I've also read from others that internet was not provided. This is true, they do have a "pay" option but not worth the price. This is one of the areas in the park with no cell reception at all so if you want to stay connected to the outside world this would not be the place to do that.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Overall I'd give the hotel a B.
reviews.title: Terribly expensive, little value for money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: 2 nights of hell. Run down, dirty, and needs a paint job equates to a Holiday Inn. The room overlooked the lake and has a bathroom. The bed and pillows sucked. Did see otters and ducks in the river. Bison are all over the place. My cell phone does not work here (AT & T) and there is no WIFI. This place really does need to get into the 21st century. There is no coffee to go; you have to sit down and have breakfast to get a drink. The dinner was OK; the food is the same at all the resorts.
reviews.title: Run down and dirty

likes.disliked: — Dirty, run down down, lousy bed and pillows

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed 3 nights in a stand alone cabin at the hotel and while it was small and "rustic", we enjoyed our stay. Every morning we awoke to Bison right outside our cabin. We ate at the Lake Lodge cafeteria for most breakfasts and dinners. The food was not great but was decent (esp breakfast). The only thing we didn't like was the driving distance between the our room and the main attractions of the park. Next time, we may stay in a more central location. Overall, we really enjoyed our cabin and would recommend it to anyone looking for a nice, quiet, clean hotel with wonderful atmosphere.
reviews.title: Loved the Cabins!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Yellowstone Hotel is a wonderful place to stay, to relax, and to eat! Rooms were very good. The lobby is wonderful. The restaurant had excellent food and wonderful wait staff! We would return in a heartbeat!
reviews.title: Favorite place in Yellowstone
Lunch and Dinner at Lake Yellowstone Hotel
reviews.text: My spouse and I were not guests of the hotel. We visited twice, once for an exceptional lunch in the brightly lit dining room and once for dinner. Both experiences exceeded our expectations. The wait staff was wonderful. Timing by the staff was great for meal ordering and delivery. We will always look back on these two experiences as very positive moments in our visit to Yellowstone. The blue cheese salad dressing was exceptional and I truly enjoyed the chilled cucumber soup. We hope your experience is as positive as ours. We did learn that you can call the park reservation number after 3:30 p.m. to learn of any dinner cancellations for that evening. We called about 3 p.m. and were able to secure a reservation for 2 persons that evening for dinner. It was the perfect end to the day.
This was my sixth stay at Lake Yellowstone Hotel.
reviews.title: Exposure to the Past
